title: What song or album made you want to visit somewhere? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks Alan. I thought of a lot of places mentioned in songs. Pink Floyd made Jupiter and Titan sound pretty cool in “Astronomy Domine”, although I’d probably be better off taking their advice and going to “San Tropez.” It’s just that I feel like I’ve already been there after hearing the song.   The dark side of the moon I’m ruling out. Donovan made me yearn (*really Dave?) for an impossible destination. (unless it’s just a place in the mind) I’d better bring my fins. (flippers)  The Climax Blues Band weren’t very convincing when they sang about this place. “Nogales” I do love this song though, I’d just like to keep my money and shoes.  Eric Burdon And The Animals made the case for this place. “Monterey” I’ve been there, several times. The Aquarium there is a must visit, you really **otter see it.  Monterey Bay Aquarium Verified 47,546 subscribers 318 videos Located at the ocean's edge, the Monterey Bay Aquarium is your window to marine life -- for dive masters and non-swimmers alike ...  I wonder if Eric’s been there? Besides music I’m really keen on baseball, I’ll bet dollars to donuts you never heard this song. “Dodger Stadium” by Maury Wills, Willie Davis, and Stubby Kaye. Boy, that takes me back, sigh.  Yes, I have this album, you gotta listen to that song I’m telling you. You’ll have a new favorite. Unless you’re a giants fan, ugh! So many great places, I’m barely scratching the surface. Another trip to outer space courtesy of Tones On Tail “Twist” Where did those seagulls come from? Space Seagulls? I thought Daniel was singing about the planet where the alphabet starts with Z?  Space, France, Mexico, California, and back to Space. It is a hard decision. How about Hawaii? I wanna go here, to “Pipeline”! We’re going with The Ventures instead of The Chantays because this video is why I wanna go there.  I can’t breath in space anyway. *yes, really. I’m allowed some yearning. ** Pun intended

every concert recording and release made me want to get to Red Rocks. Growing up in AZ as a very serious rock fan… Red Rocks was on the bucket list. All I knew was tucked in the mountains somewhere called ‘Morrison, CO’. When I moved here, I learned it’s just a Denver suburb. Even better, when there are not concerts, its a public park. People go there every day to exercise. Even better, since it is a public park… you can bring a guitar and play on stage. yes, I have played Red Rocks! btw, it is everything you have heard and dreamed and more. You really must come for a show. Wifey and I make it to at least 1 show a year. This year has been 3 already, and 1 more coming up in Sept (Beck!) it is in the foothills of the Rockies. Being where it is, it is VERY steep. As a result, when you are there… you are looking down at the band. Over the band and the stage is all of Denver laid out in the distance. Lemme see if I can find a pic that conveys this.
